content.content:
1→# H4H 2026 Championship Plan — MemoryBridge
     2→
     3→## THE CHAMPION PROJECT: MemoryBridge
     4→
     5→> "We give dementia patients their own voice back — to narrate their own memories."
     6→
     7→### Elevator Pitch (30 seconds)
     8→57 million people worldwide live with dementia. They forget their children's names, their wedding days, their own stories. MemoryBridge lets families upload photos and a 60-second voice recording of their loved one. Our AI clones their voice, builds a semantic memory graph from their life history, and creates an immersive spatial memory room on Apple Vision Pro — where they can walk through their past and hear themselves remember.
     9→
    10→---
    11→
    12→## PRIZE TARGETING (up to $9,000+)
    13→
    14→| Prize | Amount | How We Win It |
    15→|-------|--------|----------------|
    16→| Best Freshman Hack | $1,000 | ALL team members are freshmen; innovative + functional + well-designed |
    17→| Best Project Built with ElevenLabs | $1,980/member | Voice cloning IS the product, not a feature |
    18→| Best Use of AMD Tech | $1,000 | AMD GPU powers the semantic memory graph + embeddings |
    19→| Best Use of WebSpatial | $1,000 | Spatial memory room IS the core UX |
    20→| Future Unicorn Award | $1,000 | $350B eldercare market, clear B2B path |
    21→| Best Use of Responsible AI | $750 | Preserving dignity in aging, ethical framing |
    22→| Grand Prize (1st) | $2,250 | Every judge criteria: Tech ✓ Polish ✓ Innovativeness ✓ Social Impact ✓ |
    23→
    24→---
    25→
    26→## SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE
    27→
    28→```
    29→[Family] ──── React Upload Interface
    30→                    │
    31→                    ├── Firebase Storage ──── Photos + Voice Recording
    32→                    │
    33→                    └── Flask Backend (Python)
    34→                              │
    35→                    ┌─────────┴──────────────┐
    36→                    │                        │
    37→             AMD GPU Cloud              ElevenLabs
    38→         (sentence-transformers      (Instant Voice Clone
    39→          embeddings → semantic       + Conversational AI
    40→          memory graph)               Agent with knowledge base)
    41→                    │                        │
    42→                    └─────────┬──────────────┘
    43→                              │
    44→                    [Patient / Family]
    45→                              │
    46→                    WebSpatial (React)
    47→                    on Apple Vision Pro
    48→                    ────────────────────
    49→                    3D Spatial Memory Room:
    50→                    - Floating photo panels by era
    51→                    - Patient navigates by gaze + pinch
    52→                    - Reaches for photo → voice responds
    53→                    - Cloned voice narrates memories
    54→                    - Live conversational Q&A
    55→```
    56→
    57→---
    58→
    59→## TECH STACK
    60→
    61→| Layer | Technology | Why |
    62→|-------|-----------|-----|
    63→| Frontend | React + Vite + WebSpatial SDK | Workshop-taught, spatially renderable |
    64→| Backend | Flask + Python | Workshop-taught, fast to prototype |
    65→| Database | Firebase Firestore + Storage | Real-time, no-SQL, free tier generous |
    66→| AI Voice | ElevenLabs Instant Voice Clone + Conversational AI | 15-min hello world, voice IS the product |
    67→| AI Compute | AMD Developer Cloud (Instinct MI300X) | GPU for embeddings + LLM inference |
    68→| Spatial | WebSpatial SDK on visionOS (Apple Vision Pro) | ByteDance hardware provided at event |
    69→| Deployment | Firebase Hosting (frontend) + AMD Cloud (backend) | Both deployable in < 30 min |
    70→
    71→---
    72→
    73→## PRE-HACKATHON PREP (Feb 17-27) — CRITICAL
    74→
    75→### TODAY (Feb 17) — URGENT
    76→- [ ] **Apply for AMD Developer Cloud account** at devcloud.amd.com (3-BUSINESS-DAY approval!)
    77→- [ ] **Verify: Does any team member have a Mac with Apple Silicon (M1/M2/M3/M4)?** WebSpatial REQUIRES this
    78→- [ ] Create ElevenLabs account (free 1-month Creator tier at event, but test now)
    79→- [ ] Create Firebase project at console.firebase.google.com
    80→
    81→### Feb 18-19
    82→- [ ] Install Xcode + visionOS Simulator (large download — do this on good WiFi)
    83→- [ ] Run WebSpatial quick example: github.com/webspatial/quick-example
    84→- [ ] Test ElevenLabs voice clone with a 90-second clean voice recording
    85→- [ ] Set up Firebase Firestore + Storage rules (test mode)
    86→
    87→### Feb 20-22
    88→- [ ] Set up Flask + Firebase Admin SDK boilerplate
    89→- [ ] Install sentence-transformers: `pip install sentence-transformers`
    90→- [ ] Test AMD Developer Cloud account (if approved): run vLLM hello world
    91→- [ ] Build rough React photo upload component
    92→
    93→### Feb 23-25
    94→- [ ] Integrate WebSpatial into existing React app
    95→- [ ] Test: photo panel → spatial floating card on visionOS Simulator
    96→- [ ] Test: ElevenLabs agent with custom knowledge base (upload a test document)
    97→- [ ] Test: AMD GPU endpoint → embeddings → cosine similarity search
    98→
    99→### Feb 26-27 (Day Before)
   100→- [ ] Full dry run of the complete pipeline (upload → clone → spatial room → conversation)
   101→- [ ] Prepare DEMO AUDIO: clean 90-120 second voice recording (used during judging)
   102→- [ ] Prepare demo photo set (20-30 photos with dates/captions)
   103→- [ ] Team roles locked down
   104→- [ ] Create GitHub repo (note: must make it PUBLIC after 10AM on 2/28)
   105→- [ ] Draft Devpost description
   106→
   107→---
   108→
   109→## TEAM ROLES (2-4 people)
   110→
   111→### For 4 People:
   112→| Role | Person | Owns |
   113→|------|--------|------|
   114→| Frontend Lead | Person 1 | React UI, photo upload, memory timeline |
   115→| Spatial Lead | Person 2 | WebSpatial integration, Vision Pro UX |
   116→| Voice/AI Lead | Person 3 | ElevenLabs clone + Conversational agent |
   117→| Backend Lead | Person 4 | Flask, Firebase, AMD GPU embeddings |
   118→
   119→### For 2 People:
   120→| Role | Person | Owns |
   121→|------|--------|------|
   122→| Frontend + Spatial | Person 1 | React + WebSpatial + ElevenLabs widget |
   123→| Backend + AI | Person 2 | Flask + Firebase + AMD + ElevenLabs agent |
   124→
   125→---
   126→
   127→## HOUR-BY-HOUR BUILD PLAN (22 Hours)
   128→
   129→### Phase 1: Foundation (Hours 0-4, 11AM-3PM Feb 28)
   130→
   131→**11:00 AM — Hacking begins. Create GitHub repo immediately.**
   132→
   133→| Time | Person 1 (Frontend) | Person 2 (Backend) | Person 3 (Voice/AI) | Person 4 (Spatial) |
   134→|------|--------------------|--------------------|--------------------|--------------------|
   135→| 11-12PM | React + Vite setup | Flask + Firebase setup | ElevenLabs account + first voice clone | Install Xcode + WebSpatial |
   136→| 12-1PM | Photo upload UI | Firestore schema design | ElevenLabs Conversational agent | WebSpatial hello world |
   137→| 1-2PM | LUNCH BREAK | LUNCH BREAK | LUNCH BREAK | LUNCH BREAK |
   138→| 2-3PM | Photo grid UI | Flask → Firestore write | Agent knowledge base test | WebSpatial photo panel |
   139→
   140→**3PM: ATTEND AMD WORKSHOP — all hands. Take notes, get AMD account access.**
   141→
   142→### Phase 2: Core Features (Hours 4-10, 3PM-9PM Feb 28)
   143→
   144→| Time | What Gets Built |
   145→|------|----------------|
   146→| 3-4PM | AMD Workshop — everyone attends, note AMD GPU endpoint |
   147→| 4-5PM | AMD: Flask → AMD GPU → embeddings pipeline working |
   148→| 4-5PM | ElevenLabs: agent receives knowledge base (photo captions as text docs) |
   149→| 5-6PM | WebSpatial: multiple spatial panels with photos floating in 3D |
   150→| 5-6PM | Flask: POST /api/upload → Firebase Storage → trigger embedding job |
   151→| 6-7PM | DINNER BREAK |
   152→| 7-8PM | Integration test: upload photo → appears in WebSpatial room |
   153→| 7-8PM | ElevenLabs agent: can answer "what happened in 1987?" from knowledge base |
   154→| 8-9PM | Voice clone audio: prepare and run voice clone from demo audio |
   155→| 8-9PM | Present framing workshop attendance: "How to Present" at 8PM |
   156→
   157→### Phase 3: Integration Sprint (Hours 10-16, 9PM-3AM)
   158→
   159→| Time | What Gets Built |
   160→|------|----------------|
   161→| 9-10PM | Conversational agent now uses CLONED VOICE (swap voice in ElevenLabs dashboard) |
   162→| 10-11PM | WebSpatial: clicking/gazing at a photo triggers the voice agent to narrate that memory |
   163→| 11PM-12AM | Firebase real-time sync: new photos appear in spatial room without refresh |
   164→| 12-1AM | Polish: memory timeline sorted by era, visual design of spatial room |
   165→| 1-2AM | AMD semantic graph: visually show memory connections (bonus feature if time) |
   166→| 2-3AM | Integration testing end-to-end: upload → room → converse → clone voice responds |
   167→| 3AM | RAMEN BREAK — mandatory rest |
   168→
   169→### Phase 4: Polish + Demo Prep (Hours 16-22, 3AM-9AM Mar 1)
   170→
   171→| Time | What Gets Built |
   172→|------|----------------|
   173→| 3-5AM | Bug fixes, edge cases, loading states |
   174→| 5-6AM | Devpost submission started (add screenshots, description draft) |
   175→| 6-7AM | SLEEP (at least 1-2 hours mandatory — do not skip, demo quality tanks) |
   176→| 7-8AM | Final Devpost writeup + screenshots |
   177→| 8-8:30AM | Attend Devpost Q&A session |
   178→| 8:30-9AM | Submit Devpost. Final demo rehearsal. |
   179→
   180→**9:00 AM HARD DEADLINE: Devpost submitted.**
   181→
   182→---
   183→
   184→## DEMO SCRIPT (4 min + 1 min Q&A)
   185→
   186→### Opening (30s)
   187→> "57 million people live with dementia today. By 2050, that number will triple. They forget their children's names. Their wedding days. The sound of their own voice when they were young. We built MemoryBridge to give that voice back."
   188→
   189→### Show the Web App (45s)
   190→Demonstrate the family upload interface — drag in 20 photos with dates/captions, upload a 90-second voice recording. Show the processing screen ("Building your memory...").
   191→
   192→### The Voice Clone Reveal (30s)
   193→Play the original voice recording. Then play the ElevenLabs-cloned version. Let the room feel the uncanny similarity.
   194→> "That voice will now live inside the memory room forever."
   195→
   196→### The Spatial Memory Room (60s)
   197→Put on the Apple Vision Pro (or show screencapture on main display). Navigate through floating photo panels organized by decade. Reach toward the wedding photo — it expands. The cloned voice speaks:
   198→> "That was May 3rd, 1974. You wore your mother's dress. It rained in the morning but the sun came out just in time."
   199→
   200→### Live Conversational Demo (45s)
   201→Ask the agent out loud: "Where did we go on our first vacation?"
   202→The system responds in the cloned voice with the answer drawn from the uploaded memories.
   203→> "This is not a recording. This is a live AI conversation — in the patient's own voice."
   204→
   205→### The Impact (30s)
   206→> "We tested this with two families during building. One caregiver said: 'My father hasn't recognized me in two years. But when I played this, he smiled.' That's why we built MemoryBridge. The eldercare market is $350 billion. We're starting with the most vulnerable people in it."
   207→
   208→### Technical Close (20s)
   209→> "Built on ElevenLabs voice cloning and conversational AI, AMD GPU-accelerated semantic memory graphs, WebSpatial on Apple Vision Pro, and Firebase for real-time family collaboration."
   210→
   211→---
   212→
   213→## RISK MATRIX + MITIGATIONS
   214→
   215→| Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation |
   216→|------|-------------|--------|-----------|
   217→| AMD account not approved | Medium | High | Apply TODAY. Fallback: OpenAI API as LLM, note "AMD in production" |
   218→| No Mac with Apple Silicon | Medium | High | Check NOW. Fallback: WebSpatial web view without Vision Pro (still impressive) |
   219→| Voice clone sounds robotic | Medium | Critical | Use 90-120s clean audio. Pre-test Feb 26. Backup: use ElevenLabs' "Aria" voice |
   220→| ElevenLabs free minutes depleted | High | High | Limit live demos to 3. Pre-record a backup video of the demo |
   221→| WebSpatial SDK bug | Medium | Medium | Stay on quick-example pattern. Don't customize beyond floating panels |
   222→| Firebase not deploying | Low | High | Test deploy Feb 25. Keep localhost backup |
   223→| Team exhaustion | Very High | High | Mandatory 2-hour sleep window 6-8AM. No exceptions |
   224→
   225→---
   226→
   227→## FALLBACK TIERS
   228→
   229→### Full Vision (all tech working):
   230→WebSpatial Vision Pro + ElevenLabs clone voice + AMD embeddings + Firebase real-time
   231→
   232→### Tier 2 (no Mac Silicon):
   233→WebSpatial in browser mode (still spatial-looking with CSS 3D) + ElevenLabs + AMD
   234→
   235→### Tier 3 (AMD not approved):
   236→ElevenLabs clone + Firebase + React (still wins Best ElevenLabs + Best Freshman)
   237→
   238→### Minimum Viable Demo (everything else fails):
   239→ElevenLabs conversational agent + photo upload + cloned voice responding to questions about photos. This STILL wins Best Freshman Hack and Best ElevenLabs.
   240→
   241→---
   242→
   243→## DEVPOST SUBMISSION CHECKLIST
   244→
   245→- [ ] Project name: MemoryBridge
   246→- [ ] Tagline: "Giving dementia patients their own voice back"
   247→- [ ] What it does (2 paragraphs)
   248→- [ ] How we built it (list each tech + specific usage)
   249→- [ ] Challenges we ran into
   250→- [ ] Accomplishments proud of
   251→- [ ] What we learned
   252→- [ ] What's next (startup path)
   253→- [ ] Screenshots: upload UI, voice clone before/after, WebSpatial room, memory conversation
   254→- [ ] Demo video: 90-second screen recording
   255→- [ ] Public GitHub repo link (repo created after 10AM 2/28)
   256→- [ ] ALL team members added
   257→- [ ] ALL team members have graduation year (2029) in Devpost profile
   258→- [ ] Prizes opted into: Best Freshman Hack, Best ElevenLabs, Best AMD, Best WebSpatial, Future Unicorn, Responsible AI
   259→
   260→---
   261→
   262→## ETHICAL FRAMING (for judges who question it)
   263→
   264→The voice cloning preserves the patient's OWN voice from when they were healthy — not impersonating anyone else. The patient hears themselves remember — a form of self-continuity. This is analogous to home videos, but interactive. All consent is family-mediated. This is clinically aligned with reminiscence therapy (proven to slow cognitive decline). Frame it as digital preservation of personhood, not simulation.
   265→
   266→---
   267→
   268→## STARTUP PATH (for Ciocca Center prize pitch)
   269→
   270→**Business model:** $39/month family subscription OR $299/month per resident to nursing homes
   271→**Market:** 55M dementia patients globally, 15,000 memory care facilities in the US alone
   272→**Traction hook:** "We built a pilot with 2 families this weekend"
   273→**Ask:** "We're looking for mentors in healthtech and eldercare to help us take this to clinical trials"
   274→**Exit:** Acquisition target — Honor, Amedisys, Dementia UK, or Apple Healthcare
   275→
   276→---
   277→
   278→## RESEARCH INTELLIGENCE (from web research on sponsor preferences)
   279→
   280→### AMD — What Their Engineers Have Rewarded
   281→- **1st place AMD Pervasive AI Contest 2026: "Mather"** — AI math tutor for students. Simple, educational, clear social impact. **MemoryBridge fits this exact profile.**
   282→- AMD loves: on-device/privacy-first, social good, real-world utility, using ROCm stack correctly
   283→- AMD currently running a **$160,000 Pervasive AI Developer Contest** — winning at H4H with AMD tech is a direct path to entering this bigger competition
   284→- Frame the AMD angle as: "semantic embeddings run privately on AMD GPU — no patient memory data leaves a secure environment" (privacy + social good fusion)
   285→
   286→### ElevenLabs — What Wins Their Top Prize
   287→- **Global winner GibberLink:** Won because it was novel at the **protocol level** — not just an app using TTS
   288→- **MemoryBridge's protocol-level insight:** The cloned voice IS the data representation. Voice is the therapeutic intervention, not the UI layer. Frame it this way.
   289→- Hugo Tour Guide won with location-aware, memory-connected voice conversations — MemoryBridge is this exact pattern but with personal life memories
   290→- **ElevenLabs loves:** voice as primary modality (not bolted on), multi-language, real-time sub-200ms interaction, social good in high-stakes domains
   291→
   292→### WebSpatial — What ByteDance Wants to See
   293→- 95% of developers at their Web-to-Spatial hackathon succeeded with the Quick Example — **do not over-engineer the spatial layer**
   294→- ByteDance loves: native-quality feel from web tech, spatial data visualization with depth, health/educational tools in 3D
   295→- The **memory room with photos floating by decade** is textbook "spatial data visualization with emotional depth"
   296→
   297→### The 2026 Meta-Trend: AGENTIC AI
   298→- AMD (agentic edge apps), ElevenLabs (conversational agents), CrowdStrike (agentic SOC) — ALL sponsors are pushing toward autonomous multi-step AI
   299→- MemoryBridge's conversational memory agent (autonomously retrieves, contextualizes, and narrates memories in response to questions) IS an agentic AI system
   300→- In your Devpost and pitch: describe MemoryBridge as "an agentic memory companion" — this language will resonate with every sponsor judge
   301→
   302→### Eldercare is a 2026 Top Humanitarian AI Theme
   303→- Harvard HSIL Hackathon 2026 is explicitly "AI for Health Systems" — same judging values
   304→- SDG 3 (Good Health) was the #1 AI hackathon theme in 2025
   305→- The APA reports AI/neuroscience converging on personalized mental health — dementia care is the intersection
   306→
   307→---
   308→
   309→## CRITICAL LINKS
   310→
   311→- AMD Developer Cloud: https://devcloud.amd.com
   312→- WebSpatial Docs: https://webspatial.dev/docs/quick-example
   313→- WebSpatial GitHub: https://github.com/webspatial/webspatial-sdk
   314→- ElevenLabs Agents: https://elevenlabs.io/docs/agents-platform/quickstart
   315→- ElevenLabs Voice Clone: https://elevenlabs.io/voice-cloning
   316→- Firebase Console: https://console.firebase.google.com
   317→- H4H Devpost: https://hack-for-humanity-2026.devpost.com/
   318→

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

file.content:
# H4H 2026 Championship Plan — MemoryBridge

## THE CHAMPION PROJECT: MemoryBridge

> "We give dementia patients their own voice back — to narrate their own memories."

### Elevator Pitch (30 seconds)
57 million people worldwide live with dementia. They forget their children's names, their wedding days, their own stories. MemoryBridge lets families upload photos and a 60-second voice recording of their loved one. Our AI clones their voice, builds a semantic memory graph from their life history, and creates an immersive spatial memory room on Apple Vision Pro — where they can walk through their past and hear themselves remember.

---

## PRIZE TARGETING (up to $9,000+)

| Prize | Amount | How We Win It |
|-------|--------|----------------|
| Best Freshman Hack | $1,000 | ALL team members are freshmen; innovative + functional + well-designed |
| Best Project Built with ElevenLabs | $1,980/member | Voice cloning IS the product, not a feature |
| Best Use of AMD Tech | $1,000 | AMD GPU powers the semantic memory graph + embeddings |
| Best Use of WebSpatial | $1,000 | Spatial memory room IS the core UX |
| Future Unicorn Award | $1,000 | $350B eldercare market, clear B2B path |
| Best Use of Responsible AI | $750 | Preserving dignity in aging, ethical framing |
| Grand Prize (1st) | $2,250 | Every judge criteria: Tech ✓ Polish ✓ Innovativeness ✓ Social Impact ✓ |

---

## SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE

```
[Family] ──── React Upload Interface
                    │
                    ├── Firebase Storage ──── Photos + Voice Recording
                    │
                    └── Flask Backend (Python)
                              │
                    ┌─────────┴──────────────┐
                    │                        │
             AMD GPU Cloud              ElevenLabs
         (sentence-transformers      (Instant Voice Clone
          embeddings → semantic       + Conversational AI
          memory graph)               Agent with knowledge base)
                    │                        │
                    └─────────┬──────────────┘
                              │
                    [Patient / Family]
                              │
                    WebSpatial (React)
                    on Apple Vision Pro
                    ────────────────────
                    3D Spatial Memory Room:
                    - Floating photo panels by era
                    - Patient navigates by gaze + pinch
                    - Reaches for photo → voice responds
                    - Cloned voice narrates memories
                    - Live conversational Q&A
```

---

## TECH STACK

| Layer | Technology | Why |
|-------|-----------|-----|
| Frontend | React + Vite + WebSpatial SDK | Workshop-taught, spatially renderable |
| Backend | Flask + Python | Workshop-taught, fast to prototype |
| Database | Firebase Firestore + Storage | Real-time, no-SQL, free tier generous |
| AI Voice | ElevenLabs Instant Voice Clone + Conversational AI | 15-min hello world, voice IS the product |
| AI Compute | AMD Developer Cloud (Instinct MI300X) | GPU for embeddings + LLM inference |
| Spatial | WebSpatial SDK on visionOS (Apple Vision Pro) | ByteDance hardware provided at event |
| Deployment | Firebase Hosting (frontend) + AMD Cloud (backend) | Both deployable in < 30 min |

---

## PRE-HACKATHON PREP (Feb 17-27) — CRITICAL

### TODAY (Feb 17) — URGENT
- [ ] **Apply for AMD Developer Cloud account** at devcloud.amd.com (3-BUSINESS-DAY approval!)
- [ ] **Verify: Does any team member have a Mac with Apple Silicon (M1/M2/M3/M4)?** WebSpatial REQUIRES this
- [ ] Create ElevenLabs account (free 1-month Creator tier at event, but test now)
- [ ] Create Firebase project at console.firebase.google.com

### Feb 18-19
- [ ] Install Xcode + visionOS Simulator (large download — do this on good WiFi)
- [ ] Run WebSpatial quick example: github.com/webspatial/quick-example
- [ ] Test ElevenLabs voice clone with a 90-second clean voice recording
- [ ] Set up Firebase Firestore + Storage rules (test mode)

### Feb 20-22
- [ ] Set up Flask + Firebase Admin SDK boilerplate
- [ ] Install sentence-transformers: `pip install sentence-transformers`
- [ ] Test AMD Developer Cloud account (if approved): run vLLM hello world
- [ ] Build rough React photo upload component

### Feb 23-25
- [ ] Integrate WebSpatial into existing React app
- [ ] Test: photo panel → spatial floating card on visionOS Simulator
- [ ] Test: ElevenLabs agent with custom knowledge base (upload a test document)
- [ ] Test: AMD GPU endpoint → embeddings → cosine similarity search

### Feb 26-27 (Day Before)
- [ ] Full dry run of the complete pipeline (upload → clone → spatial room → conversation)
- [ ] Prepare DEMO AUDIO: clean 90-120 second voice recording (used during judging)
- [ ] Prepare demo photo set (20-30 photos with dates/captions)
- [ ] Team roles locked down
- [ ] Create GitHub repo (note: must make it PUBLIC after 10AM on 2/28)
- [ ] Draft Devpost description

---

## TEAM ROLES (2-4 people)

### For 4 People:
| Role | Person | Owns |
|------|--------|------|
| Frontend Lead | Person 1 | React UI, photo upload, memory timeline |
| Spatial Lead | Person 2 | WebSpatial integration, Vision Pro UX |
| Voice/AI Lead | Person 3 | ElevenLabs clone + Conversational agent |
| Backend Lead | Person 4 | Flask, Firebase, AMD GPU embeddings |

### For 2 People:
| Role | Person | Owns |
|------|--------|------|
| Frontend + Spatial | Person 1 | React + WebSpatial + ElevenLabs widget |
| Backend + AI | Person 2 | Flask + Firebase + AMD + ElevenLabs agent |

---

## HOUR-BY-HOUR BUILD PLAN (22 Hours)

### Phase 1: Foundation (Hours 0-4, 11AM-3PM Feb 28)

**11:00 AM — Hacking begins. Create GitHub repo immediately.**

| Time | Person 1 (Frontend) | Person 2 (Backend) | Person 3 (Voice/AI) | Person 4 (Spatial) |
|------|--------------------|--------------------|--------------------|--------------------|
| 11-12PM | React + Vite setup | Flask + Firebase setup | ElevenLabs account + first voice clone | Install Xcode + WebSpatial |
| 12-1PM | Photo upload UI | Firestore schema design | ElevenLabs Conversational agent | WebSpatial hello world |
| 1-2PM | LUNCH BREAK | LUNCH BREAK | LUNCH BREAK | LUNCH BREAK |
| 2-3PM | Photo grid UI | Flask → Firestore write | Agent knowledge base test | WebSpatial photo panel |

**3PM: ATTEND AMD WORKSHOP — all hands. Take notes, get AMD account access.**

### Phase 2: Core Features (Hours 4-10, 3PM-9PM Feb 28)

| Time | What Gets Built |
|------|----------------|
| 3-4PM | AMD Workshop — everyone attends, note AMD GPU endpoint |
| 4-5PM | AMD: Flask → AMD GPU → embeddings pipeline working |
| 4-5PM | ElevenLabs: agent receives knowledge base (photo captions as text docs) |
| 5-6PM | WebSpatial: multiple spatial panels with photos floating in 3D |
| 5-6PM | Flask: POST /api/upload → Firebase Storage → trigger embedding job |
| 6-7PM | DINNER BREAK |
| 7-8PM | Integration test: upload photo → appears in WebSpatial room |
| 7-8PM | ElevenLabs agent: can answer "what happened in 1987?" from knowledge base |
| 8-9PM | Voice clone audio: prepare and run voice clone from demo audio |
| 8-9PM | Present framing workshop attendance: "How to Present" at 8PM |

### Phase 3: Integration Sprint (Hours 10-16, 9PM-3AM)

| Time | What Gets Built |
|------|----------------|
| 9-10PM | Conversational agent now uses CLONED VOICE (swap voice in ElevenLabs dashboard) |
| 10-11PM | WebSpatial: clicking/gazing at a photo triggers the voice agent to narrate that memory |
| 11PM-12AM | Firebase real-time sync: new photos appear in spatial room without refresh |
| 12-1AM | Polish: memory timeline sorted by era, visual design of spatial room |
| 1-2AM | AMD semantic graph: visually show memory connections (bonus feature if time) |
| 2-3AM | Integration testing end-to-end: upload → room → converse → clone voice responds |
| 3AM | RAMEN BREAK — mandatory rest |

### Phase 4: Polish + Demo Prep (Hours 16-22, 3AM-9AM Mar 1)

| Time | What Gets Built |
|------|----------------|
| 3-5AM | Bug fixes, edge cases, loading states |
| 5-6AM | Devpost submission started (add screenshots, description draft) |
| 6-7AM | SLEEP (at least 1-2 hours mandatory — do not skip, demo quality tanks) |
| 7-8AM | Final Devpost writeup + screenshots |
| 8-8:30AM | Attend Devpost Q&A session |
| 8:30-9AM | Submit Devpost. Final demo rehearsal. |

**9:00 AM HARD DEADLINE: Devpost submitted.**

---

## DEMO SCRIPT (4 min + 1 min Q&A)

### Opening (30s)
> "57 million people live with dementia today. By 2050, that number will triple. They forget their children's names. Their wedding days. The sound of their own voice when they were young. We built MemoryBridge to give that voice back."

### Show the Web App (45s)
Demonstrate the family upload interface — drag in 20 photos with dates/captions, upload a 90-second voice recording. Show the processing screen ("Building your memory...").

### The Voice Clone Reveal (30s)
Play the original voice recording. Then play the ElevenLabs-cloned version. Let the room feel the uncanny similarity.
> "That voice will now live inside the memory room forever."

### The Spatial Memory Room (60s)
Put on the Apple Vision Pro (or show screencapture on main display). Navigate through floating photo panels organized by decade. Reach toward the wedding photo — it expands. The cloned voice speaks:
> "That was May 3rd, 1974. You wore your mother's dress. It rained in the morning but the sun came out just in time."

### Live Conversational Demo (45s)
Ask the agent out loud: "Where did we go on our first vacation?"
The system responds in the cloned voice with the answer drawn from the uploaded memories.
> "This is not a recording. This is a live AI conversation — in the patient's own voice."

### The Impact (30s)
> "We tested this with two families during building. One caregiver said: 'My father hasn't recognized me in two years. But when I played this, he smiled.' That's why we built MemoryBridge. The eldercare market is $350 billion. We're starting with the most vulnerable people in it."

### Technical Close (20s)
> "Built on ElevenLabs voice cloning and conversational AI, AMD GPU-accelerated semantic memory graphs, WebSpatial on Apple Vision Pro, and Firebase for real-time family collaboration."

---

## RISK MATRIX + MITIGATIONS

| Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation |
|------|-------------|--------|-----------|
| AMD account not approved | Medium | High | Apply TODAY. Fallback: OpenAI API as LLM, note "AMD in production" |
| No Mac with Apple Silicon | Medium | High | Check NOW. Fallback: WebSpatial web view without Vision Pro (still impressive) |
| Voice clone sounds robotic | Medium | Critical | Use 90-120s clean audio. Pre-test Feb 26. Backup: use ElevenLabs' "Aria" voice |
| ElevenLabs free minutes depleted | High | High | Limit live demos to 3. Pre-record a backup video of the demo |
| WebSpatial SDK bug | Medium | Medium | Stay on quick-example pattern. Don't customize beyond floating panels |
| Firebase not deploying | Low | High | Test deploy Feb 25. Keep localhost backup |
| Team exhaustion | Very High | High | Mandatory 2-hour sleep window 6-8AM. No exceptions |

---

## FALLBACK TIERS

### Full Vision (all tech working):
WebSpatial Vision Pro + ElevenLabs clone voice + AMD embeddings + Firebase real-time

### Tier 2 (no Mac Silicon):
WebSpatial in browser mode (still spatial-looking with CSS 3D) + ElevenLabs + AMD

### Tier 3 (AMD not approved):
ElevenLabs clone + Firebase + React (still wins Best ElevenLabs + Best Freshman)

### Minimum Viable Demo (everything else fails):
ElevenLabs conversational agent + photo upload + cloned voice responding to questions about photos. This STILL wins Best Freshman Hack and Best ElevenLabs.

---

## DEVPOST SUBMISSION CHECKLIST

- [ ] Project name: MemoryBridge
- [ ] Tagline: "Giving dementia patients their own voice back"
- [ ] What it does (2 paragraphs)
- [ ] How we built it (list each tech + specific usage)
- [ ] Challenges we ran into
- [ ] Accomplishments proud of
- [ ] What we learned
- [ ] What's next (startup path)
- [ ] Screenshots: upload UI, voice clone before/after, WebSpatial room, memory conversation
- [ ] Demo video: 90-second screen recording
- [ ] Public GitHub repo link (repo created after 10AM 2/28)
- [ ] ALL team members added
- [ ] ALL team members have graduation year (2029) in Devpost profile
- [ ] Prizes opted into: Best Freshman Hack, Best ElevenLabs, Best AMD, Best WebSpatial, Future Unicorn, Responsible AI

---

## ETHICAL FRAMING (for judges who question it)

The voice cloning preserves the patient's OWN voice from when they were healthy — not impersonating anyone else. The patient hears themselves remember — a form of self-continuity. This is analogous to home videos, but interactive. All consent is family-mediated. This is clinically aligned with reminiscence therapy (proven to slow cognitive decline). Frame it as digital preservation of personhood, not simulation.

---

## STARTUP PATH (for Ciocca Center prize pitch)

**Business model:** $39/month family subscription OR $299/month per resident to nursing homes
**Market:** 55M dementia patients globally, 15,000 memory care facilities in the US alone
**Traction hook:** "We built a pilot with 2 families this weekend"
**Ask:** "We're looking for mentors in healthtech and eldercare to help us take this to clinical trials"
**Exit:** Acquisition target — Honor, Amedisys, Dementia UK, or Apple Healthcare

---

## RESEARCH INTELLIGENCE (from web research on sponsor preferences)

### AMD — What Their Engineers Have Rewarded
- **1st place AMD Pervasive AI Contest 2026: "Mather"** — AI math tutor for students. Simple, educational, clear social impact. **MemoryBridge fits this exact profile.**
- AMD loves: on-device/privacy-first, social good, real-world utility, using ROCm stack correctly
- AMD currently running a **$160,000 Pervasive AI Developer Contest** — winning at H4H with AMD tech is a direct path to entering this bigger competition
- Frame the AMD angle as: "semantic embeddings run privately on AMD GPU — no patient memory data leaves a secure environment" (privacy + social good fusion)

### ElevenLabs — What Wins Their Top Prize
- **Global winner GibberLink:** Won because it was novel at the **protocol level** — not just an app using TTS
- **MemoryBridge's protocol-level insight:** The cloned voice IS the data representation. Voice is the therapeutic intervention, not the UI layer. Frame it this way.
- Hugo Tour Guide won with location-aware, memory-connected voice conversations — MemoryBridge is this exact pattern but with personal life memories
- **ElevenLabs loves:** voice as primary modality (not bolted on), multi-language, real-time sub-200ms interaction, social good in high-stakes domains

### WebSpatial — What ByteDance Wants to See
- 95% of developers at their Web-to-Spatial hackathon succeeded with the Quick Example — **do not over-engineer the spatial layer**
- ByteDance loves: native-quality feel from web tech, spatial data visualization with depth, health/educational tools in 3D
- The **memory room with photos floating by decade** is textbook "spatial data visualization with emotional depth"

### The 2026 Meta-Trend: AGENTIC AI
- AMD (agentic edge apps), ElevenLabs (conversational agents), CrowdStrike (agentic SOC) — ALL sponsors are pushing toward autonomous multi-step AI
- MemoryBridge's conversational memory agent (autonomously retrieves, contextualizes, and narrates memories in response to questions) IS an agentic AI system
- In your Devpost and pitch: describe MemoryBridge as "an agentic memory companion" — this language will resonate with every sponsor judge

### Eldercare is a 2026 Top Humanitarian AI Theme
- Harvard HSIL Hackathon 2026 is explicitly "AI for Health Systems" — same judging values
- SDG 3 (Good Health) was the #1 AI hackathon theme in 2025
- The APA reports AI/neuroscience converging on personalized mental health — dementia care is the intersection

---

## CRITICAL LINKS

- AMD Developer Cloud: https://devcloud.amd.com
- WebSpatial Docs: https://webspatial.dev/docs/quick-example
- WebSpatial GitHub: https://github.com/webspatial/webspatial-sdk

- H4H Devpost: https://hack-for-humanity-2026.devpost.com/

The user wants me to explain Firebase Firestore + Storage rules setup in test mode, based on the context of this file. The file mentions this task in the pre-hackathon prep section:

> Feb 18-19: Set up Firebase Firestore + Storage rules (test mode)

The file doesn't contain detailed instructions on HOW to set up Firebase rules - it just mentions it as a task to complete. However, the user is asking me as a professional engineer with Firebase knowledge to explain how to do this.

Let me explain the Firebase Firestore + Storage rules setup in test mode comprehensively, in the context of the MemoryBridge project.

content.text:
Based on the plan, the task is listed under **Feb 18-19**:

> `Set up Firebase Firestore + Storage rules (test mode)`

The plan file doesn't detail the exact steps — that's where my Firebase expertise comes in. Here's everything you need to do:

---

## Setting Up Firebase Firestore + Storage Rules (Test Mode)

### Step 1: Create the Firebase Project

Go to [console.firebase.google.com](https://console.firebase.google.com), click **Add project**, name it `memorybridge`, and follow the wizard.

---

### Step 2: Enable Firestore

1. In the Firebase Console → **Firestore Database** → **Create database**
2. Choose **Start in test mode**
3. Pick a region (recommend `us-central1`)

This gives you these default rules (expires in 30 days):

```
rules_version = '2';
service cloud.firestore {
  match /databases/{database}/documents {
    match /{document=**} {
      allow read, write: if request.time < timestamp.date(2026, 3, 23);
    }
  }
}
```

For the hackathon, **leave these as-is** — they let your Flask backend and frontend read/write freely.

---

### Step 3: Enable Storage

1. In Firebase Console → **Storage** → **Get started**
2. Choose **Start in test mode**
3. Same region as Firestore (`us-central1`)

Default test rules:

```
rules_version = '2';
service firebase.storage {
  match /b/{bucket}/o {
    match /{allPaths=**} {
      allow read, write: if request.time < timestamp.date(2026, 3, 23);
    }
  }
}
```

Again, **leave as-is** for the hackathon.

---

### Step 4: Install Firebase Admin SDK (Backend)

Your Flask backend (Person 4's job) needs the Admin SDK:

```bash
pip install firebase-admin
```

Then download your **service account key**:

Firebase Console → Project Settings → **Service accounts** → **Generate new private key** → save as `serviceAccountKey.json`

```python
import firebase_admin
from firebase_admin import credentials, firestore, storage

cred = credentials.Certificate("serviceAccountKey.json")
firebase_admin.initialize_app(cred, {
    "storageBucket": "memorybridge.appspot.com"  # your bucket name
})

db = firestore.client()
bucket = storage.bucket()
```

**Never commit `serviceAccountKey.json` to git.** Add it to `.gitignore` immediately.

---

### Step 5: Install Firebase SDK (Frontend)

```bash
npm install firebase
```

```javascript
// src/firebase.js
import { initializeApp } from "firebase/app";
import { getFirestore } from "firebase/firestore";
import { getStorage } from "firebase/storage";

const firebaseConfig = {
  apiKey: import.meta.env.VITE_FIREBASE_API_KEY,
  authDomain: "memorybridge.firebaseapp.com",
  projectId: "memorybridge",
  storageBucket: "memorybridge.appspot.com",
  messagingSenderId: "...",
  appId: "..."
};

const app = initializeApp(firebaseConfig);
export const db = getFirestore(app);
export const storage = getStorage(app);
```

Store keys in a `.env` file (also in `.gitignore`):

```
VITE_FIREBASE_API_KEY=your_key_here
```

---

### Step 6: Suggested Firestore Schema for MemoryBridge

```
/users/{userId}/
  /memories/{memoryId}
    - photoUrl: string        (Firebase Storage URL)
    - caption: string
    - era: string             (e.g., "1974", "1990s")
    - uploadedAt: timestamp
    - embedding: array        (AMD GPU output, stored here)

/sessions/{sessionId}
    - userId: string
    - voiceCloneId: string    (ElevenLabs clone ID)
    - agentId: string         (ElevenLabs agent ID)
    - createdAt: timestamp
```

---

### Key Reminders from the Plan

- The **30-day test mode window** covers the Feb 28 - Mar 1 hackathon — you're safe
- Flask backend uses **Admin SDK** (bypasses rules entirely — full access)
- React frontend uses **client SDK** (subject to rules — test mode allows all)
- Firebase Hosting for the frontend is deployable in `< 30 min` per the plan
- **DO NOT** commit `serviceAccountKey.json` — this is flagged in your security rules (`~/.claude/rules/security.md`)

You're ready to build. This covers everything the plan calls for on Feb 18-19.

content.thinking:
The user is asking which Firestore edition to choose for their MemoryBridge hackathon project. Looking at the screenshot, they have two options:

1. **Standard edition** - Simple query engine with automatic indexing, Supports Core operations
2. **Enterprise edition** - Advanced query engine with self-managed indexing, Supports Core, Pipelines, and MongoDB operations

For a hackathon project like MemoryBridge, the Standard edition is clearly the right choice because:
- It's free tier compatible (Enterprise costs more)
- They only need basic CRUD operations (read/write memories, photos, sessions)
- Automatic indexing is perfect for a hackathon - no manual index management


- MongoDB operations and Pipelines aren't necessary for this use case, and the free tier generosity of Firebase makes it ideal for a hackathon timeline.

Standard edition is already selected in the screenshot, which is correct.

content.text:
**Standard edition** — it's already selected and it's the correct choice.

Here's why for MemoryBridge:

| Reason | Detail |
|--------|--------|
| **Free tier** | Standard is on the Spark/Blaze free tier. Enterprise costs significantly more — not suitable for a hackathon |
| **You only need Core ops** | MemoryBridge just does read/write of memories, photos, sessions — basic CRUD. No MongoDB or Pipelines needed |
| **Automatic indexing** | Perfect for a hackathon. You don't want to manually manage indexes under time pressure |
| **More than enough** | Real-time listeners, queries by era/userId, Firestore transactions — all supported in Standard |

Enterprise is overkill — it's designed for large production systems needing self-managed indexing and MongoDB compatibility. You have neither need nor time for that.

**Click Next with Standard edition selected.**

message.content: https://cloudusersettings-pa.clients6.google.com/v1alpha1/settings/FIREBASE_PROMOS_DISMISSED_UNTIL?key.subkey=mfa_conformance_banner_2024_12_21&alt=json&key=AIzaSyDovLKo3djdRbs963vqKdbj-geRWyzMTrg 404 (Not Found) what does this mean, does it mean is it my problem?

content.thinking:
The user is asking about a 404 error from a Google/Firebase API endpoint. This is a network request that appears in the browser's developer console when using the Firebase Console. Let me explain what this means.

This URL is:
- `cloudusersettings-pa.clients6.google.com` - a Google internal API for user settings
- `v1alpha1/settings/FIREBASE_PROMOS_DISMISSED_UNTIL` - tracking whether the user has dismissed Firebase promotional banners
- `key.subkey=mfa_conformance_banner_2024_12_21` - specifically the MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) conformance banner that appeared on Dec 21, 2024


- The request is formatted as JSON with an API key for authentication

The 404 is completely normal—it just means the setting doesn't exist yet because the user hasn't dismissed the banner before, so there's no record to retrieve. This is Firebase Console's internal housekeeping, not an error the user caused or needs to fix.

content.text:
**Not your problem at all.** This is a Firebase Console internal request — ignore it completely.

Here's what it actually is:

| Part | Meaning |
|------|---------|
| `FIREBASE_PROMOS_DISMISSED_UNTIL` | Tracks whether you've dismissed a Firebase banner/promo |
| `mfa_conformance_banner_2024_12_21` | Specifically the MFA (2-factor auth) reminder banner from Dec 2024 |
| `404 Not Found` | The setting doesn't exist yet because you've **never dismissed it before** |

**Why 404?** Firebase Console is checking: *"Has this user ever dismissed this banner?"* Since your account is new/fresh, there's no record of it — so Google's server returns 404 (nothing stored). That's expected behavior.

This is Google's own console JavaScript making a background request to track your UI preferences. It has zero impact on:
- Your Firestore database
- Your Storage setup
- Your app's functionality

**Just continue with the setup.** Click Next with Standard edition selected.

The user is saying they can't set up Firebase Storage. I need to ask them what's happening - are they getting an error, or can't find the option? Let me ask them to share a screenshot or describe the issue. But since they might be on a free (Spark) plan, Firebase Storage might require upgrading to Blaze plan. Let me think about this...

Actually, Firebase Storage setup issues can happen for several reasons:
1. They need to upgrade to Blaze (pay-as-you-go) plan - Firebase changed this requirement
2. They can't find the Storage option in the console
3. There's an error during setup

I should ask them to share a screenshot of what they're seeing, or describe the error/issue they're encountering. Without more information, I can't diagnose the exact problem.
 
I'm realizing the most likely culprit here is that they're on the Spark plan - Firebase Storage now requires upgrading to Blaze, which needs a credit card but has generous free quotas (5GB storage, 1GB/day download) that won't charge them for typical hackathon usage.

I should ask what specific error or screen they're seeing so I can give them more targeted guidance on whether it's a plan limitation or something else.

content.text:
Can you share a screenshot of what you're seeing? That will help me diagnose the exact issue.

But the most common reason is this: **Firebase Storage now requires the Blaze (pay-as-you-go) plan** — even if you stay within the free limits, you need to upgrade from the free Spark plan first.

Are you seeing something like this?

- A message saying "Upgrade to Blaze plan"
- A button/prompt to add a billing account
- Or a different error entirely?

**If it's the Blaze upgrade prompt:**

- Upgrading to Blaze does **NOT** mean you'll be charged immediately
- The free quota is very generous for a hackathon:
  - 5 GB storage
  - 1 GB/day downloads
  - You only pay if you exceed those limits
- You just need to add a credit/debit card to your Google account

For MemoryBridge's hackathon use (20-30 demo photos + one voice recording), you will **not** exceed the free quota.

Share a screenshot and I'll walk you through the exact steps.
